item.title: Overflowing bins, mattress, builders waste, polystyrene packaging, 23rd December
item.description:

item.title: Tons of dumped rubbish yet again, 23rd December
item.description:
Once again, we are happy to complain about rubbish outside our general Dental practice, why does the council not do something about it? This is a weekly occurrence and it must cost the council a fortune to keep removing the rubbish rather than trying to stop it happening by the use of CCTV or similar measures

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleanliness concerns due to persistent litter, 23rd December
item.description:
Bins regularly overflow due to insufficient collection. Animals tear open the bags, causing litter to spread across the street and pavement. Street cleanliness has deteriorated recently. The area needs a thorough clean and more frequent bin collections to prevent ongoing litter issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lorrimore Square, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Slippery leaves, 23rd December
item.description:
The leaves in Lawn Road just outside Amberley Court have not been cleared for weeks. It is at the junction of Copers Cope Road and Lawn Road. The leaves are on the pavement and also covering the grass. Copers Cope Road is usually cleaned but Lawn Road is left uncleaned. Please remove the leaves from outside Amberley Court and other parts of Lawn Road where needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lawn Road, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping on top of not collected leaves, 23rd December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Flaxton Road, Plumstead
